text: Wark Bridge is an iron bridge over the River North Tyne at Wark on Tyne in Northumberland. ==History== The bridge, which replaced a bridge of timber construction, was built by Hawks, Crawshay and Sons of Gateshead and opened in 1878. It underwent a major refurbishment in stages between 2010 and 2015. ==References== Category:Bridges in Northumberland Category:Crossings of the River Tyne
title: Wark Bridge
